channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Myanmar sees deadliest day as 38 protesters killed
item.description: Security forces reportedly opened fire on large crowds in Mandalay and Monywa on Wednesday.

item.title: ICC opens 'war crimes' investigation in West Bank and Gaza
item.description: Israel rejects the court's decision to probe alleged war crimes, while the Palestinians praise it.

item.title: Covid: Biden promises vaccines for all US adults by end of May
item.description: The US president also insists the "fight is not over", as some states move to relax Covid rules.

item.title: Germany to spy on far-right AfD party, reports say
item.description: The intelligence services have not publicly confirmed the move, which the AfD is fighting in court.

item.title: Man guilty of killing 10 in Toronto attack
item.description: A judge ruled against Alek Minassian, whose lawyers said he was not criminally responsible due to autism.

item.title: 'Vaccine, vaccine' - Dolly sings before Covid-19 jab
item.description: "Vaccine, vaccine, vaccine, vaccine,” the country star sings before she receives a jab.

item.title: Covid: Police break up 'fake vaccine network' in China and South Africa
item.description: Thousands of doses of suspected counterfeit vaccine are seized by police in China and South Africa.

item.title: Greece earthquake shakes shop and collapses buildings
item.description: The 6.3 magnitude earthquake struck near the city of Larissa, but was felt across the country.

item.title: Covid-19: Backlash in Spain over princesses getting UAE vaccines
item.description: The sisters say they were offered the jab when visiting their father in the United Arab Emirates.

item.title: South Korea's first transgender soldier found dead
item.description: Byun Hee-soo had been dismissed by the military for undergoing gender reassignment surgery.

item.title: Covid: Brazil's daily deaths reach all-time high
item.description: The daily toll reached 1,641 on Tuesday, Brazil's highest figure since the pandemic started.

item.title: India is now only 'partly free' under Modi, says report
item.description: Rights group Freedom House notes a steady erosion of democracy in India, amid declining liberty globally.

item.title: Mars: Nasa's Perseverance rover sends stunning images
item.description: Amazing images as Nasa's Perseverance rover lands on Mars and seeks signs of past microbial life.

item.title: DR Congo's Virunga National Park: The deadly job of protecting gorillas
item.description: In the past year, more than 20 rangers have been killed defending Africa's oldest national park.

item.title: Why many in Russia are reluctant to have Sputnik vaccine
item.description: Russia's Sputnik V vaccine against Covid is in worldwide demand, but many Russians remain unsure.

item.title: The couples accused of destroying Japan's families
item.description: An archaic Japanese law requires married couples to adopt the same surname, but many are asking why.

item.title: How US nuclear missiles found a base in Scotland
item.description: The controversial US nuclear submarines operated for more than 30 years and has a lasting legacy.

item.title: How can we make washing machines last?
item.description: Sweden is trying to encourage consumers to repair household items like washing machines.

item.title: Myanmar anti-coup protesters flee from tear gas
item.description: Video footage shows anti-coup demonstrators running to avoid tear gas fired by police.

item.title: World's first platypus refuge in Australia
item.description: Conservationists in Australia have announced exciting plans to open the world's first platypus refuge.

item.title: Mount Sinabung: Time-lapse shows Indonesia volcano's 5km-high ash cloud
item.description: The latest eruption from Mount Sinabung in North Sumatra sends ash up to 5km (3.1 miles) into the air.

item.title: Myanmar coup: Singapore PM Lee says situation 'tragic'
item.description: Speaking to the BBC, Lee Hsien Loong condemns the use of violence against unarmed protesters.

item.title: Video shows 2020 Iranian missile attack on US forces at Iraqi base
item.description: Iran targeted an Iraqi base hosting US troops to avenge the assassination of Gen Qasem Soleimani.
